abstract.text: A remote player who the local player running your game can invite and communicate with through Game Center.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Before using Game Center for the first time, players create a single account that identifies them across all Game Center games. The player only needs to sign in to Game Center once per device to start using GameKit features in your game. A player sets a nickname and avatar in their account that provide a consistent and familiar look in your game. Game Center then uses the account to record leaderboard scores and achievements, and to start games with other players.
represents remote or other players who the local player running your app can invite and communicate with.
is also the superclass for the local player

method. GameKit treats guest players similar to Game Center players except they can’t earn achievements, post to leaderboards, or participate in challenges.

abstract.text: A notification that posts after GameKit authenticates the local player.
A notification that posts when a player object’s data changes.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
A class that provides common data and methods for the different player objects.
The local player who signs in to Game Center on the device running the game.
A protocol that handles events for Game Center players.
A remote player who the local player running your game can invite and communicate with through Game Center.
The size of a photo that Game Center loads.
A string the player chooses to identify themself to other players.
Creates a guest player with the specified identifier.
A string to display for the player.
A unique identifier for a player of the game.
A developer-created string that identifies a guest player.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the player is a friend of the local player.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the local player can send an invitation to the player.
Loads a photo of the player from Game Center.
Loads information about a list of players from Game Center.
A unique identifier for a player of the game.
Returns a Boolean value depending on whether the player identifiers are persistent across game instances or unique to the game instance.
A unique identifier for a player of all the games that you distribute using your developer account.
A notification that posts after GameKit authenticates the local player.
A notification that posts when a player object’s data changes.
A constant for a player ID that’s no longer available.
Confirm player credentials and device capabilities and check for account restrictions.
Give players the ability to connect and interact with friends in your game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Connecting players with their friends in your game

abstract.text: Use the scoped identifiers that GameKit provides you as player IDs when transmitting or saving player data.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Protecting the player’s privacy using scoped identifiers

abstract.text: Save game data during play or after a game in the player’s iCloud account that’s accessible from any device.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Saving the player’s game data to an iCloud account

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
